title.rendered: Embrace Your Royal Destiny: Walking in God’s Divine Authority

content.rendered:
Introduction

In the heart of every believer lies a destiny of royalty, a call to reign and rule as kings. This divine mandate is not just a lofty ideal but a practical reality that every Christian should embrace. As we delve into the Scriptures, we discover that God’s eternal plan for His people is one of royalty, authority, and dominion. This message is not just about feeling good or being motivated; it’s about understanding your divine mandate and walking in the authority that God has bestowed upon you. Whether you’re facing challenges at work, in your family, or in your personal life, the truths we’ll explore will equip you to rise above and reign as the king you were destined to be.

Keypoints

  • God’s eternal plan for His people is royalty and dominion.
  • Royalty is rooted in righteousness and upright living.
  • Embracing your royal identity involves authority, prosperity, opportunity, dignity, quality, and security.
  • Practical application of biblical principles is key to walking in your royal destiny.

The Genesis of Royalty

The journey of royalty begins at the very dawn of creation. In Genesis 1:28, God blessed humanity and commanded them to “be fruitful and multiply; fill the earth and subdue it; have dominion over the fish of the sea, over the birds of the air, and over every living thing that moves upon the earth.” This mandate was not just a task but a conferring of royal status. Adam and Eve were created to be kings, to rule and have dominion over the earth on God’s behalf.

Prayer Point: Father, help me to understand and embrace the dominion mandate you have given me from the beginning.

Declaration: I declare that I am created to rule and have dominion over every circumstance and challenge I face, in Jesus’ name.

Personal Reflection: How have I been exercising the dominion mandate in my life? What areas do I need to take more authority in?

Psalm 8:4-5 reiterates this royal status: “What is man that You are mindful of him, and the son of man that You visit him? For You have made him a little lower than the angels, and You have crowned him with glory and honor.” This crown of glory and honor is not just a poetic expression but a spiritual reality that every believer should walk in.

Scripture Reference:

> "What is man that You are mindful of him, and the son of man that You visit him? For You have made him a little lower than the angels, and You have crowned him with glory and honor." (Psalm 8:4-5)

Royalty in the Covenant

The covenant God made with Abraham further underscores the theme of royalty. Abraham operated in a realm of royalty, relating with kings and even being acknowledged as a prince among them. In Genesis 14:17, after Abraham’s victory over the kings, the king of Sodom came to meet him, recognizing his superior status. Similarly, in Genesis 23:5-6, the Hittites addressed Abraham as a “mighty prince” among them.

Prayer Point: Lord, help me to walk in the royalty of the Abrahamic covenant, relating with the world from a position of authority and honor.

Declaration: I declare that I am a mighty prince, a seed of Abraham, walking in royalty and honor, in Jesus’ name.

Personal Reflection: How have I been relating to the world around me? Do I carry the royalty of the Abrahamic covenant in my interactions?

God’s promise to Abraham in Genesis 17:6 further confirms this royal status: “I will make you exceedingly fruitful; and I will make nations of you, and kings shall come from you.” This promise shows that royalty is not just for Abraham but for every seed of Abraham, which includes all believers (Galatians 3:29).

Scripture Reference:

> "I will make you exceedingly fruitful; and I will make nations of you, and kings shall come from you." (Genesis 17:6)

Royalty in the Prophets

The prophets of old also spoke of the royalty of God’s people. Isaiah 28:5 declares, “In that day the Lord of hosts will be for a crown of glory and a diadem of beauty to the remnant of His people.” This crown of glory is a symbol of royalty, honor, and beauty that sets God’s people apart.

Prayer Point: Father, adorn me with the crown of glory and the diadem of beauty, that I may walk in the royalty you have destined for me.

Declaration: I declare that I am crowned with glory and adorned with beauty, a royal priest in God’s kingdom, in Jesus’ name.

Personal Reflection: How have I been carrying myself? Do I reflect the glory and beauty of the Lord in my daily life?

The royal priesthood spoken of in 1 Peter 2:9 is a culmination of this theme: “But you are a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, His own special people, that you may proclaim the praises of Him who called you out of darkness into His marvelous light.” This royal priesthood is a call to reign as kings and serve as priests, a dual role that every believer is called to.

Scripture Reference:

> "But you are a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, His own special people, that you may proclaim the praises of Him who called you out of darkness into His marvelous light." (1 Peter 2:9)

Royalty in the New Covenant

The New Covenant brings the theme of royalty to a whole new level. Revelation 1:5-6 speaks of Jesus Christ as the “Prince of the kings of the earth” who has “made us kings and priests to His God and Father.” This royal status is not something we will attain in the future but a present reality for every believer.

Prayer Point: Lord Jesus, thank you for making me a king and a priest. Help me to walk in this royal status and fulfill my priestly duties.

Declaration: I declare that I am a king and a priest, reigning with Christ and serving in His kingdom, in Jesus’ name.

Personal Reflection: How have I been walking in my royal status and fulfilling my priestly duties? What areas do I need to improve in?

Revelation 5:9-10 further confirms this: “And they sang a new song, saying: ‘You are worthy to take the scroll, and to open its seals; for You were slain, and have redeemed us to God by Your blood out of every tribe and tongue and people and nation, and have made us kings and priests to our God; and we shall reign on the earth.'” This song of the redeemed highlights the destiny of royalty that every believer is called to.

Scripture Reference:

> "And they sang a new song, saying: 'You are worthy to take the scroll, and to open its seals; for You were slain, and have redeemed us to God by Your blood out of every tribe and tongue and people and nation, and have made us kings and priests to our God; and we shall reign on the earth.'" (Revelation 5:9-10)

Pillars of Royalty

Walking in royalty involves understanding and embracing certain pillars that uphold this divine mandate. These pillars include authority, prosperity, opportunity, dignity, quality, and security.

Authority: Royalty is synonymous with authority. As kings, we have the authority to decree a thing and see it established (Job 22:28). This authority is not just positional but functional, affecting every area of our lives.

Prayer Point: Father, help me to walk in the authority you have given me, decreeing and seeing your will established in my life and circumstances.

Declaration: I declare that I have the authority to decree a thing and see it established, in Jesus’ name.

Prosperity: Royalty is also marked by prosperity. This is not just financial prosperity but a holistic well-being that encompasses every area of life. As kings, we should not be beggars but givers, reflecting the abundant nature of our King (2 Corinthians 9:8).

Prayer Point: Lord, help me to walk in the prosperity of my royal status, being a blessing to others and reflecting your abundant nature.

Declaration: I declare that I walk in divine prosperity, being a blessing to others and reflecting God’s abundant nature, in Jesus’ name.

Opportunity: Royalty opens doors of opportunity. Favor is a natural byproduct of royalty, causing doors to open and paths to be made straight (Proverbs 3:5-6). As kings, we should expect and embrace opportunities that come our way, knowing that they are divinely orchestrated.

Prayer Point: Father, open doors of opportunity for me, causing your favor to surround me as a shield.

Declaration: I declare that doors of opportunity are opened for me, and your favor surrounds me as a shield, in Jesus’ name.

Dignity, Quality, and Security

Dignity: Royalty carries with it a sense of dignity and honor. This is not pride but a healthy self-respect that commands respect from others (Proverbs 22:4). As kings, we should carry ourselves with dignity, knowing that we represent the King of kings.

Prayer Point: Lord, help me to carry myself with dignity, reflecting your royal nature in my conduct and character.

Declaration: I declare that I carry myself with dignity and honor, reflecting the royal nature of my King, in Jesus’ name.

Quality: Royalty is also marked by quality. Kings deserve and should expect the best (Daniel 1:8). This is not about being extravagant but about understanding our worth and value in God’s kingdom.

Prayer Point: Father, help me to walk in the quality that befits my royal status, expecting and embracing the best you have for me.

Declaration: I declare that I walk in the quality that befits my royal status, expecting and embracing the best God has for me, in Jesus’ name.

Security: Finally, royalty involves a sense of security. This is not just physical security but a spiritual immunity that protects us from the enemy’s attacks (Psalm 91:1-2). As kings, we should walk in this security, knowing that we are untouchable by the enemy.

Prayer Point: Lord, surround me with your divine security, making me untouchable by the enemy’s attacks.

Declaration: I declare that I am surrounded by divine security, untouchable by the enemy’s attacks, in Jesus’ name.

Personal Reflection: How have I been walking in these pillars of royalty? What areas do I need to improve in?

Royalty of Righteousness

It’s important to note that our royalty is rooted in righteousness. Psalm 45:6-7 speaks of God’s throne being established forever and ever, a scepter of righteousness being the scepter of His kingdom. This righteousness is not just positional but practical, affecting every area of our lives.

Prayer Point: Father, help me to walk in the righteousness that upholds my royal status, living a life that pleases you.

Declaration: I declare that I walk in righteousness, upholding my royal status and living a life that pleases God, in Jesus’ name.

Personal Reflection: How have I been walking in righteousness? What areas do I need to surrender to God’s lordship?

Isaiah 45:7-8 confirms this: “I form the light and create darkness, I make peace and create calamity; I, the Lord, do all these things… Let the heavens rain righteousness; Let the earth open, let them bring forth salvation, and let righteousness spring up together. I, the Lord, have created it.” This righteousness is a gift from God, a fruit of our salvation that we should cultivate and grow in.

Scripture Reference:

> "I form the light and create darkness, I make peace and create calamity; I, the Lord, do all these things... Let the heavens rain righteousness; Let the earth open, let them bring forth salvation, and let righteousness spring up together. I, the Lord, have created it." (Isaiah 45:7-8)

Walking in Your Royal Destiny

Walking in our royal destiny involves practical steps that we can take to apply these principles to our lives. Here are some actionable steps:

  1. Embrace Your Identity: Understand and embrace your royal identity. You are not a beggar but a king, not a slave but a son. Walk in the consciousness of your royal status.

  2. Exercise Your Authority: Begin to exercise your authority, decreeing and declaring God’s will in your life and circumstances. Remember, you have the authority to decree a thing and see it established.

  3. Expect Prosperity: Expect and embrace prosperity. This is not just financial prosperity but a holistic well-being that encompasses every area of your life.

  4. Seize Opportunities: Embrace opportunities that come your way, knowing that they are divinely orchestrated. Walk in the favor that your royal status affords you.

  5. Carry Yourself with Dignity: Carry yourself with dignity and honor, reflecting the royal nature of your King in your conduct and character.

  6. Demand Quality: Expect and embrace quality, understanding your worth and value in God’s kingdom.

  7. Walk in Security: Walk in the security that your royal status affords you, knowing that you are untouchable by the enemy’s attacks.

  8. Cultivate Righteousness: Cultivate and grow in righteousness, living a life that pleases God and upholds your royal status.

Prayer Point: Father, help me to walk in my royal destiny, embracing my identity, exercising my authority, expecting prosperity, seizing opportunities, carrying myself with dignity, demanding quality, walking in security, and cultivating righteousness.

Declaration: I declare that I am walking in my royal destiny, embracing my identity, exercising my authority, expecting prosperity, seizing opportunities, carrying myself with dignity, demanding quality, walking in security, and cultivating righteousness, in Jesus’ name.

Personal Reflection: How have I been walking in my royal destiny? What areas do I need to improve in?

Conclusion

In conclusion, your destiny of royalty is not just a theological concept but a practical reality that you should embrace and walk in. As a king in God’s kingdom, you are called to reign and rule, to exercise authority, and to reflect God’s royal nature in every area of your life.

Call to Action: Take some time to reflect on the pillars of royalty and the practical steps you can take to walk in your royal destiny. Make a commitment to embrace your royal identity, exercise your authority, expect prosperity, seize opportunities, carry yourself with dignity, demand quality, walk in security, and cultivate righteousness.

Blessing/Declaration: May you walk in the fullness of your royal destiny, reigning and ruling as a king in God’s kingdom. May you embrace your royal identity, exercise your authority, expect prosperity, seize opportunities, carry yourself with dignity, demand quality, walk in security, and cultivate righteousness, in Jesus’ name.

FAQs

  1. What does it mean to be a king in God’s kingdom?
  • Being a king in God’s kingdom means embracing your royal identity, exercising your authority, expecting prosperity, seizing opportunities, carrying yourself with dignity, demanding quality, walking in security, and cultivating righteousness.
  1. How can I walk in the authority that God has given me?
  • You can walk in the authority that God has given you by understanding and embracing your royal identity, decreeing and declaring God’s will in your life and circumstances, and expecting to see His will established.
  1. What is the significance of righteousness in my royal destiny?
  • Righteousness is the foundation of your royal destiny. It is not just positional but practical, affecting every area of your life. Cultivating and growing in righteousness is key to walking in your royal destiny.
  1. How can I expect and embrace prosperity as a king in God’s kingdom?
  • You can expect and embrace prosperity by understanding that it is a natural byproduct of royalty. This is not just financial prosperity but a holistic well-being that encompasses every area of your life.
  1. What are some practical steps I can take to walk in my royal destiny?
  • Some practical steps you can take to walk in your royal destiny include embracing your identity, exercising your authority, expecting prosperity, seizing opportunities, carrying yourself with dignity, demanding quality, walking in security, and cultivating righteousness.
  1. How does royalty relate to opportunities and favor?
  • Royalty opens doors of opportunity and favor. As a king in God’s kingdom, you should expect and embrace opportunities that come your way, knowing that they are divinely orchestrated.
  1. How can I carry myself with dignity and honor as a king in God’s kingdom?
  • You can carry yourself with dignity and honor by understanding your royal status, reflecting the royal nature of your King in your conduct and character, and commanding respect from others.
  1. What is the significance of security in my royal destiny?
  • Security is a natural byproduct of royalty. As a king in God’s kingdom, you should walk in the security that your royal status affords you, knowing that you are untouchable by the enemy’s attacks.

title.rendered: The Power of a Divine Encounter: Transform Your Life with God’s Presence

content.rendered:
Introduction

In the hustle and bustle of life, it’s easy to feel overwhelmed, exhausted, and uncertain about the future. Whether it’s the relentless pace of work, the challenges of family life, or the constant barrage of negative news, we often find ourselves wondering if there’s more to life than just surviving. In the midst of this chaos, we need a divine encounter—a moment where God breaks through the noise and transforms our reality.

The story of Jacob in the Bible is a powerful reminder of how one divine encounter can change everything. Jacob, a man on the run from his brother Esau, found himself at a crossroads. Exhausted and fearful, he lay down to sleep and had a dream that would alter the course of his life. This dream was more than just a fleeting vision; it was a divine encounter that revealed the power of God and the promises He had for Jacob.

As we delve into Jacob’s story, we’ll explore the profound impact of a divine encounter and how it can transform our weariness into relief, our darkness into light, and our uncertainty into a guaranteed future. Whether you’re facing personal struggles, spiritual battles, or simply seeking a deeper connection with God, this journey through Jacob’s experience will provide practical steps and spiritual insights to help you encounter God in a fresh and powerful way.

The Relief of Weariness

Life can be exhausting. The constant demands of work, family, and personal responsibilities can leave us feeling drained and overwhelmed. Jacob knew this feeling all too well. Fleeing from his brother Esau, who sought to kill him, Jacob was not only physically tired but also emotionally and spiritually drained. The fear of being pursued and the uncertainty of his future weighed heavily on him.

In Genesis 28:11-12, we find Jacob at a turning point. He lay down to sleep, using a stone as a pillow, and had a dream that would change everything. In this dream, he saw a ladder reaching from earth to heaven, with angels ascending and descending on it. This vision was more than just a dream; it was a divine encounter that brought relief to Jacob’s weariness.

Practical Application:

  • Take Time to Rest: Just as Jacob took a moment to rest, we too need to pause and find moments of rest in our busy lives. This could be a quiet time of prayer, meditation, or simply taking a break from our daily routines.
  • Seek God’s Presence: In our weariness, we can find comfort and strength in God’s presence. Spend time in worship, reading the Bible, and praying, allowing God’s peace to fill your heart.

Prayer Point:
Lord, in my weariness, I come to You. Fill me with Your strength and peace, and help me to find rest in Your presence. Amen.

Declaration:
I declare that I am strengthened by the power of God. In my weariness, I find rest and renewal in His presence. (Isaiah 40:31)

Personal Reflection:

  • What areas of your life are causing you the most weariness?
  • How can you incorporating moments of rest and seeking God’s presence into your daily routine?

The Release of Light in the Midst of Night

Darkness can be both literal and metaphorical. It can represent times of isolation, confusion, and spiritual desolation. For Jacob, the night was a time of uncertainty and fear. He was alone, on the run, and unsure of what the future held. But in the midst of this darkness, God revealed Himself to Jacob through a dream.

The ladder in Jacob’s dream symbolized a bridge between heaven and earth, a connection between the divine and the human. This encounter with God brought light into Jacob’s darkness, revealing that even in the most challenging times, God is present and working on our behalf.

Practical Application:

  • Embrace Isolation: Use times of isolation as opportunities to draw closer to God. Spend time in prayer and meditation, seeking His guidance and comfort.
  • Trust in God’s Promises: Remember that God’s promises are true, even in the darkest moments. Hold onto His word and trust that He is working all things together for good.

Prayer Point:
Lord, in my times of darkness and isolation, help me to see Your light and trust in Your promises. Amen.

Declaration:
I declare that even in the darkest nights of my life, God’s light shines brightly, guiding me and revealing His presence. (Psalm 119:105)

Personal Reflection:

  • What areas of your life feel like they are in darkness or isolation?
  • How can you embrace these times as opportunities to draw closer to God?

The Release of Angelic Activity

Angelic activity is a powerful aspect of divine encounters. In Jacob’s dream, angels were ascending and descending on the ladder, symbolizing the constant movement and work of heavenly beings on our behalf. This revelation brought comfort and assurance to Jacob, knowing that he was not alone in his journey.

Angels play a crucial role in our lives, providing protection, guidance, and divine intervention. They are God’s messengers, sent to minister to us and carry out His will. When we encounter God, we also experience the release of angelic activity, which brings healing, deliverance, and breakthrough.

Practical Application:

  • Acknowledge Angelic Presence: Recognize and acknowledge the presence of angels in your life. Thank God for their protection and guidance.
  • Invoke Angelic Assistance: In times of need, invoke the help of angels through prayer and declaration, trusting that they are working on your behalf.

Prayer Point:
Lord, thank You for the ministry of angels in my life. Help me to be aware of their presence and trust in their guidance and protection. Amen.

Declaration:
I declare that angels are at work in my life, bringing healing, deliverance, and breakthrough. I am surrounded by their protection and guidance. (Psalm 91:11-12)

Personal Reflection:

  • Have you ever experienced angelic intervention in your life? If so, how did it impact you?
  • How can you incorporate acknowledging and invoking angelic assistance into your daily spiritual practice?

The Promise of a Guaranteed Future

Uncertainty about the future can be one of the most challenging aspects of life. We often wonder what lies ahead and whether our dreams and goals will be realized. For Jacob, the future was filled with questions and fears. But in his divine encounter, God made a promise that would secure his future and the future of his descendants.

In Genesis 28:13-15, God promised Jacob that the land where he lay would be given to him and his descendants. He also promised that Jacob’s seed would be as numerous as the dust of the earth and that all families of the earth would be blessed through him. This promise brought assurance and hope to Jacob, knowing that his future was in God’s hands.

Practical Application:

  • Claim God’s Promises: Hold onto the promises of God, knowing that He is faithful to fulfill them. Claim these promises over your life and the lives of your loved ones.
  • Trust in God’s Plan: Trust that God has a plan and purpose for your life. Even in times of uncertainty, know that He is working all things together for good.

Prayer Point:
Lord, help me to trust in Your promises and Your plan for my life. Give me the faith to believe that You are working all things together for good. Amen.

Declaration:
I declare that my future is secured in the promises of God. He has a plan and purpose for my life, and I trust in His faithfulness to fulfill it. (Jeremiah 29:11)

Personal Reflection:

  • What areas of your life do you feel uncertain about?
  • How can you claim God’s promises and trust in His plan for your future?

The Guarantee of Divine Protection

Divine protection is a powerful aspect of our relationship with God. In Jacob’s encounter, God promised not only a future but also protection. He assured Jacob that He would be with him and keep him in all places where he went, bringing him back to the land promised to him.

This promise of divine protection brought comfort and assurance to Jacob, knowing that God was with him and would guard him against all harm. This protection is not just physical but also spiritual, emotional, and mental, covering every aspect of our lives.

Practical Application:

  • Trust in God’s Protection: Trust that God is with you and will protect you in all situations. Know that His presence brings peace and security.
  • Claim Divine Protection: Claim the promise of divine protection over your life and the lives of your loved ones. Believe that God is your shield and defender.

Prayer Point:
Lord, thank You for Your promise of divine protection. Help me to trust in Your presence and know that You are with me, guarding me against all harm. Amen.

Declaration:
I declare that I am surrounded by God’s divine protection. He is my shield and defender, guarding me against all harm and danger. (Psalm 91:1-2)

Personal Reflection:

  • In what areas of your life do you need divine protection?
  • How can you trust and claim God’s promise of protection in your daily life?

Value for the Spiritual

One of the key factors that set Jacob apart and made him a recipient of divine encounters was his value for the spiritual. Unlike his brother Esau, who despised his birthright and sold it for a single meal, Jacob recognized the importance of spiritual things and pursued them with dedication.

Valuing the spiritual means prioritizing our relationship with God above all else. It means seeking His presence, His will, and His purposes in our lives. When we value the spiritual, we open ourselves up to divine encounters that transform our lives and bring us closer to God.

Practical Application:

  • Prioritize Spiritual Pursuits: Make spiritual pursuits a priority in your life. Spend time in prayer, worship, and studying the Bible, seeking God’s presence and will.
  • Cultivate a Spiritual Mindset: Develop a mindset that values spiritual things above temporal pleasures. Focus on eternal rewards rather than immediate gratification.

Prayer Point:
Lord, help me to value the spiritual above all else. Give me a heart that seeks Your presence and Your will in my life. Amen.

Declaration:
I declare that I value the spiritual and prioritize my relationship with God. I seek His presence, His will, and His purposes in my life. (Matthew 6:33)

Personal Reflection:

  • What areas of your life need more spiritual focus and priority?
  • How can you cultivate a mindset that values spiritual things above temporal pleasures?

The Life of Sacrifice

Sacrifice is a fundamental aspect of our relationship with God. It is through sacrifice that we demonstrate our love, devotion, and commitment to Him. In Jacob’s life, we see a pattern of sacrifice that set him apart and made him a recipient of divine encounters.

Jacob was willing to give up everything to pursue God’s will and purposes. He was willing to leave his home, his family, and his comfort to follow God’s call. This life of sacrifice brought him into a deeper relationship with God and opened the door to divine encounters that transformed his life.

Practical Application:

  • Embrace Sacrifice: Embrace a life of sacrifice, willing to give up temporal pleasures and comforts to pursue God’s will and purposes.
  • Offer Your Best: Offer your best to God, knowing that He deserves our utmost devotion and commitment.

Prayer Point:
Lord, help me to embrace a life of sacrifice, willing to give up all for Your sake. Help me to offer my best to You, knowing that You deserve my utmost devotion and commitment. Amen.

Declaration:
I declare that I embrace a life of sacrifice, offering my best to God and pursuing His will and purposes with devotion and commitment. (Romans 12:1)

Personal Reflection:

  • What areas of your life require sacrifice to pursue God’s will and purposes?
  • How can you offer your best to God in your daily life?

The Spirit of a Fighter

Jacob was not just a man of spiritual value and sacrifice; he was also a fighter. From his birth, he struggled with his brother Esau, and this fighting spirit stayed with him throughout his life. Jacob’s willingness to fight for God’s promises and purposes set him apart and made him a recipient of divine encounters.

The spirit of a fighter is essential in our spiritual journey. It is through this fighting spirit that we overcome obstacles, resist temptation, and persevere in our faith. When we embrace the spirit of a fighter, we open ourselves up to divine encounters that bring breakthrough and transformation.

Practical Application:

  • Embrace the Fight: Embrace the spirit of a fighter, willing to overcome obstacles and resist temptation in your spiritual journey.
  • Persevere in Faith: Persevere in your faith, knowing that God is with you and will bring you through every challenge.

Prayer Point:
Lord, help me to embrace the spirit of a fighter, willing to overcome obstacles and persevere in my faith. Give me the strength and courage to fight for Your promises and purposes. Amen.

Declaration:
I declare that I embrace the spirit of a fighter, overcoming obstacles and persevering in my faith. I fight for God’s promises and purposes, knowing that He is with me and will bring me through every challenge. (Ephesians 6:10-18)

Personal Reflection:

  • What obstacles are you currently facing in your spiritual journey?
  • How can you embrace the spirit of a fighter and persevere in your faith?

Conclusion

Jacob’s encounter with God transformed his life, bringing relief from weariness, light in the midst of darkness, angelic activity, a guaranteed future, divine protection, and a fighting spirit. As we reflect on Jacob’s journey, we are reminded of the power of a divine encounter and the importance of valuing the spiritual, embracing sacrifice, and fighting for God’s promises and purposes.

Call to Action:

  • Seek Divine Encounters: Pursue divine encounters in your life by prioritizing your relationship with God, embracing sacrifice, and fighting for His promises and purposes.
  • Claim God’s Promises: Hold onto the promises of God, trusting that He is faithful to fulfill them in your life.
  • Pray and Declare: Use the prayer points and declarations provided in this blog to pray and declare God’s will and purposes over your life.

Blessing:
May the Lord bless you and keep you; may the Lord make His face shine upon you and be gracious to you; may the Lord turn His face toward you and give you peace. (Numbers 6:24-26)

FAQs

  1. How can I experience a divine encounter like Jacob?
  • To experience a divine encounter, prioritize your relationship with God, embrace a life of sacrifice, and cultivate a fighting spirit. Spend time in prayer, worship, and studying the Bible, seeking God’s presence and will in your life.
  1. What is the significance of angels in divine encounters?
  • Angels play a crucial role in divine encounters, providing protection, guidance, and divine intervention. They are God’s messengers, sent to minister to us and carry out His will.
  1. How can I trust in God’s promises for my future?
  • Trusting in God’s promises involves holding onto His word and believing that He is faithful to fulfill them. Claim these promises over your life and trust that God has a plan and purpose for you.
  1. What does it mean to value the spiritual?
  • Valuing the spiritual means prioritizing our relationship with God above all else. It means seeking His presence, His will, and His purposes in our lives, and focusing on eternal rewards rather than immediate gratification.
  1. How can I embrace a life of sacrifice?
  • Embracing a life of sacrifice involves being willing to give up temporal pleasures and comforts to pursue God’s will and purposes. It means offering our best to God, knowing that He deserves our utmost devotion and commitment.
  1. What is the spirit of a fighter, and why is it important?
  • The spirit of a fighter is the willingness to overcome obstacles, resist temptation, and persevere in our faith. It is important because it helps us overcome challenges and brings breakthrough and transformation in our spiritual journey.
  1. How can I claim divine protection over my life?
  • Claiming divine protection involves trusting that God is with you and will protect you in all situations. It means claiming the promise of divine protection over your life and believing that God is your shield and defender.
  1. What practical steps can I take to apply the principles from Jacob’s encounter to my life?
  • Practical steps include prioritizing spiritual pursuits, embracing sacrifice, cultivating a fighting spirit, claiming God’s promises, and trusting in His protection. Use the prayer points and declarations provided in this blog to pray and declare God’s will and purposes over your life.

Introduction

Preservation by the Blood Sacrifice. This concept, deeply rooted in scripture, reveals a powerful truth about God’s provision for our protection and well-being. As we explore Exodus 12:13, “And the blood shall be to you for a token upon the houses where you are. And when I see the blood, I will pass over you. And the plague shall not be upon you to destroy you when I smite the land of Egypt,” we uncover the profound implications of the blood’s preserving power. Throughout history, the blood has been a symbol of life, sacrifice, and redemption. Our objective tonight is twofold: first, to understand the preservation power inherent in the blood; and second, to grasp how we can actively engage the blood for our own preservation. Leviticus 17:11 says, “It is the blood that makes an atonement for the soul”.Join me as we journey through biblical examples, practical applications, and spiritual insights to unlock the protective covering that the blood sacrifice offers. We will see how this ancient practice is relevant to our lives today, and how it can be a source of strength, security, and victory in the face of life’s challenges. May our hearts be open to receive the fullness of this truth, and may we be empowered to walk in the preserving power of the blood.

Key Takeaways

  • The blood sacrifice is a powerful symbol of God’s provision for our preservation.
  • Engaging the blood through faith activates its protective power in our lives.
  • The blood of Jesus offers a present-day, ongoing sacrifice that is relevant and powerful for believers today.

The Preservation of Adam and Eve

Our first example takes us to the very beginning, in the Garden of Eden. After Adam and Eve sinned, God declared that they would surely die. Yet, in Genesis 3:21, we see a remarkable act of mercy: “Unto Adam also and to his wife did the Lord God make coats of skins, and clothed them.” God sacrificed an animal, shedding its blood, to cover their nakedness and, I believe, to shield them from the immediate, full consequences of their sin. This act foreshadows the ultimate sacrifice of Jesus, whose blood covers our sins and protects us from eternal death.

This sets the precedent for understanding the blood sacrifice as a means of preservation. Check out this article on Understanding Sin and Redemption for more context.

Joseph’s Preservation from His Brothers

Next, we see the preservation of Joseph from the murderous plot of his brothers. In Genesis 37, Joseph’s brothers, fueled by jealousy, conspired to kill him. However, they ultimately decided to dip his coat in the blood of a goat and present it to their father, Jacob, as evidence of Joseph’s supposed death. Unbeknownst to them, this act, as recorded in Genesis 37:31-34, was a divine orchestration. The blood on the coat served as a symbolic barrier, protecting Joseph from premature death. Even through the trials he faced in Egypt, Joseph was preserved because of this seemingly insignificant act of blood sacrifice.

This story demonstrates that God can use even the seemingly negative actions of others to fulfill His purposes. This is similar to the concept discussed in our article about God’s Sovereignty in Suffering.

Rahab and the Scarlet Cord

The story of Rahab the harlot in Joshua 2:15-19 offers another powerful illustration. When Israelite spies entered Jericho, Rahab hid them and helped them escape. She lowered them down from her window using a scarlet cord, a rope that was blood-colored, symbolic of the blood. This cord not only facilitated their escape but also became a sign of salvation for Rahab and her family. When the walls of Jericho fell, the section where Rahab’s house stood, marked by the scarlet cord, remained intact. As the pastor said, “That we have come to position our lives. Both you, your family, your father’s house, I declare you are preserved.” The bloodline preserved them from destruction.

This powerful story highlights the importance of faith and obedience in the face of danger. To learn more, see our blog post on Faith in Action.

Samson’s Parents and the Angel’s Visit

In Judges 13:22, we find the parents of Samson fearing for their lives after encountering an angel. Manoah, Samson’s father, exclaimed, “We shall surely die because we have seen God.” However, his wife wisely reasoned that if God intended to kill them, He wouldn’t have accepted their burnt offering, which involved the shedding of a kid’s blood. The blood sacrifice, in essence, closed the door to any possibility of death. It served as a powerful intercessor, demonstrating that the shedding of blood can avert divine judgment.

This narrative illustrates the power of intercession and the significance of offerings. For a deeper dive, explore our article on The Power of Prayer and Intercession.

Samuel, the Army of Israel, and the Philistines

First Samuel 7:7-12 recounts how Samuel interceded for Israel during a battle against the Philistines. As the Philistines advanced, Samuel offered a suckling lamb as a burnt offering to the Lord. The Bible says, “And Samuel cried unto the Lord for Israel; and the Lord heard him.” As the sacrifice was being made, God intervened, causing a great thunderstorm that discomfited the Philistines, leading to Israel’s victory. The blood sacrifice not only secured their preservation but also brought judgment upon their enemies. The pastor powerfully declared, “The blood of Jesus is not only going to preserve you, it’s now going to cause occasion judgment in the camp of the wicked.”

This passage emphasizes the connection between sacrifice, intercession, and divine intervention. Explore our blog on Spiritual Warfare.

Samuel’s Preservation in Jesse’s House

In 1 Samuel 16:1-5, God instructed Samuel to anoint a new king from among Jesse’s sons. Samuel feared that Saul, the current king, would kill him if he learned of this. God’s solution was ingenious: He told Samuel to take a heifer and say he was going to offer a sacrifice. This seemingly deceptive act was a prophetic action with several layers of meaning. It set the stage for divine operation, prepared the ground for cleansing, and most importantly, guaranteed Samuel’s preservation from Saul’s wrath. The blood sacrifice acted as a shield, ensuring Samuel’s safety as he fulfilled God’s command.

This account reveals that God often provides unexpected strategies for our protection and guidance. Read our article Hearing God’s Voice.

David’s Blood Sacrifice for Israel’s Preservation

In 2 Samuel 24, David sinned by numbering Israel, essentially placing his trust in military might rather than in God. As a consequence, a plague struck Israel, killing 70,000 people. To stop the plague, David was instructed to build an altar and offer a sacrifice on the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite. As soon as the sacrifice was offered, the plague ceased. This demonstrates the power of the blood to appease God’s wrath and bring about restoration. The blood sacrifice acted as a mediator, stopping the destruction and restoring peace.

This powerful story reminds us of the consequences of sin and the importance of repentance. See our blog post on Repentance and Restoration.

The Moabites Victory Over Jehoshaphat’s Army

In 2 Kings 3, a coalition of Israel, Judah, and Edom went to war against Moab. Despite receiving a prophetic word of victory from Elisha, the tide turned when the king of Moab offered his eldest son as a burnt offering on the wall. This act of human sacrifice, though abhorrent, had a profound effect. The Bible says, “And there was great indignation against Israel: and they departed from him, and returned to their own land.” (2 Kings 3:27). God, who had promised victory, withdrew His support because the sacrifice reminded Him of the future sacrifice of His own Son. This demonstrates the unparalleled power of a blood sacrifice to alter even a divinely ordained outcome.

The pastor’s words resonate here: “If the word of God, the verdict of God, the decree of God, can be set aside by the power of the blood sacrifice of a human being, how much more shall the decree of a witch, a wizard, be set aside by the sacrifice of the blood of Jesus.”

How the Blood Preserves

  1. The Blood as a Ransom: The blood serves as a ransom, a price paid to redeem us from the penalty of sin. Just as the sacrificial animals took the place of humans in the Old Testament, Jesus’ blood paid the ultimate price for our sins. (Matthew 20:28, Mark 10:45, 1 Timothy 2:5-6)
  2. The Blood Transmits Life: Leviticus 17:11 states, “For the life of the flesh is in the blood.” When we partake in the communion, we are symbolically drinking the blood of Jesus, receiving His life into us. This is a life that is eternal, indestructible, and victorious over sin and death. (John 6:53-57)
  3. The Blood as a Weapon: Revelation 12:11 declares that believers overcome Satan “by the blood of the Lamb.” The blood is not just a passive symbol; it is an active weapon of defense and attack against the forces of darkness. When we plead the blood of Jesus, we are invoking its power to protect us and defeat our enemies. (Exodus 12:12-13, Zechariah 9:11-12)
  4. The Blood Speaks: The blood has a voice. In Genesis 4:10, God said that Abel’s blood cried out from the ground. Hebrews 12:24 speaks of “the blood of sprinkling that speaketh better things than that of Abel.” Jesus’ blood speaks mercy, forgiveness, and preservation over our lives.
  5. The Blood as a Channel of Blessing: 1 Corinthians 10:16 calls the communion cup “the cup of blessing.” The blessing, as described in Isaiah 65:8, prevents destruction. Therefore, partaking in the communion, engaging with the blood, connects us to the blessing that preserves and protects us from harm. The blessing is also the antidote to any curse. (Galatians 3:13)

Engaging the Blood for Preservation

Now that we understand what is in the blood and how it preserves, how do we practically engage it in our daily lives?

  1. Through the Communion Table: As stated in 1 Corinthians 10:16, the communion table is where we encounter the blood of Jesus. Partaking in communion is not merely a ritual but a powerful spiritual act where we receive the benefits of the blood.
  2. By Declarations of Faith: Revelation 12:11 also mentions that we overcome by “the word of our testimony.” We must actively declare the power of the blood over our lives, families, and situations. Just as we confess healing by His stripes, we can declare protection and victory by the blood.
  3. As Led by the Spirit: Romans 8:14 says, “For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, they are the sons of God.” There may be times when the Holy Spirit prompts us to engage the blood in specific ways, such as anointing with oil or applying the communion elements in a particular situation. We must be sensitive to His guidance.

Conclusion

Beloved, the message of preservation by the blood sacrifice is not a relic of the past but a present reality for every believer. As we’ve journeyed through these biblical examples, we’ve seen how God consistently used the blood to protect, deliver, and provide for His people. From Adam and Eve to the Israelites in Egypt, from Rahab to Samuel, and ultimately to the sacrifice of Jesus, the blood has been a powerful symbol and instrument of God’s grace. We have seen that the blood is not just a symbol but a spiritual reality that carries life, power, and the very presence of God. The blood serves as our ransom, it transmits the life of Christ into us, it acts as a weapon against the enemy, it speaks on our behalf, and it channels the blessing that preserves us from destruction.

Let us embrace the power of the blood in our lives. Let us partake in communion with reverence and faith, actively declare the blood’s power over our circumstances, and remain sensitive to the leading of the Holy Spirit. The pastor’s words echo in my heart: “You shall fulfill your days. Those pursuing you to destroy you, they shall experience their destruction.” As we engage the blood, we can walk in confidence, knowing that we are protected, preserved, and empowered to fulfill our God-given destinies. May we never forget the profound significance of the blood sacrifice and its ongoing relevance in our lives. May we live each day under the banner of the blood, experiencing its preserving power and walking in victory. Amen.

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

  1. What is the significance of the blood sacrifice in the Bible?

    The blood sacrifice in the Bible symbolizes atonement, redemption, and preservation. It signifies the payment for sin and the establishment of a covenant relationship with God.

  2. How does the blood of Jesus protect us today?

    The blood of Jesus protects us spiritually by cleansing us from sin, providing a spiritual covering, and acting as a weapon against the forces of darkness. It also speaks on our behalf, interceding for us before God.

  3. How can I apply the blood of Jesus to my life?

    You can apply the blood of Jesus through faith by partaking in communion, declaring its power over your life, and obeying the leading of the Holy Spirit.

  4. What is the difference between the Old Testament blood sacrifices and the sacrifice of Jesus?

    Old Testament blood sacrifices were temporary and had to be repeated. Jesus’ sacrifice was a one-time, perfect sacrifice that fully atoned for sin and established a new covenant.

  5. Does the blood of Jesus guarantee physical safety?

    While the blood offers spiritual protection, it doesn’t guarantee immunity from physical harm. However, it does ensure our eternal salvation and provides spiritual strength in the face of adversity.

  6. How can I pray for protection using the blood of Jesus?

    You can pray by specifically pleading the blood of Jesus over yourself, your family, and your circumstances, declaring its power to protect and deliver you from evil.

  7. What does it mean to be “under the blood”?

    Being “under the blood” means being covered by the atoning sacrifice of Jesus, receiving His forgiveness, and experiencing His protection and provision.
